image.altText: A man and a woman hugging two girls tightly while sitting in a hospital room.

props.synopsis: A delay in the release of Israeli hostages by Hamas is resolved, a Qatari official says after intervention by mediator countries.

title.children: Hamas releases hostages to Red Cross in Gaza, after earlier delay

image.altText: A black and white class photo with a male teacher. The children's faces are blurred.

props.synopsis: A Victorian government inquiry has laid bare how the state's education department protected paedophile David MacGregor, allowing him to teach and coach children for almost three decades despite multiple warnings from children and their parents.

title.children: The horror story of paedophile teacher David MacGregor has been exposed in vivid detail

image.altText: A man in a suit holding a laptop walks past a group of photographers outside

props.synopsis: When a billionaire darling of Silicon Valley became the CEO of OpenAI and built ChatGPT, he was sure it would change the world. But in one week, the collaboration between the company's altruistic board and thriving business unravelled, leaving the industry asking just how open AI is going to be in the future.

title.children: Could an AI experiment called project Q* be the reason for the OpenAI meltdown?

image.altText: A graphically altered image of a newspaper front page, a parcel and a post office.

props.synopsis: A newborn baby was found dead in a parcel, with police on opposite sides of Australia bewildered by who could've sent it. Now, DNA advancements are offering hope the six-decade 'baby in the post' mystery could soon be solved.

title.children: Decades after the grisly discovery of a baby in the post, could the case finally be solved?

image.altText: an image grab from a simulation of a driver in a car about to enter the rozelle interchange

props.synopsis: The Rozelle Interchange comprising of 16.6 kilometres of road tunnel welcomes its first lot of motorists, as drivers are warned to brace for weeks of traffic disruption and delays.

title.children: Australia's largest underground motorway maze opens in Sydney. How confusing is it to navigate?

image.altText: A wide photo of a long beach, with small boats, rubble and sheets of metal on the sand. Cars drive on a road nearby

props.synopsis: Nicole Johnston, a former Gaza-based journalist, reflects on the friends she made and the conflicts she covered in the war-torn region.

title.children: Power cuts, polluted beaches and a once thriving tunnel trade. This is life in Gaza's 'open air prison'

image.altText: mobile phone footage of paramedics and firefighters inside a restaurant tending to the injured. A car struck glass windows.

props.synopsis: A car crashes into a restaurant, injuring four customers, including a seven-year-old boy, in Adelaide's eastern suburbs.

title.children: Four people injured when car crashes through Adelaide restaurant window

image.altText: a large kitchen sink with a window above it

props.synopsis: The Halls family wanted to put their kitchen sink in the pantry so they could shut the door on the dishes. But moving it just a few feet cost them thousands of dollars.

title.children: They call it the $25k sink — the kitchen fitting that sank this family's chance of a HomeBuilder grant

image.altText: A photo of a person driving a car at sunset, taken from behind the driver's seat

props.synopsis: Psychologists say some Australians are cancelling their autism assessment appointments after learning they could be required to disclose their condition under Fitness to Drive standards.

title.children: Would you still pursue an autism diagnosis if it meant you might lose your driver's licence?

image.altText: A man with his arm around a woman, both in uniform and both looking at the camear

props.synopsis: Oleksandra and Oleksandr fight in the same Ukrainian combat unit, trying to push back invading Russian forces on the frontlines. Their bond runs even deeper than most.

title.children: The father-daughter fighting team helping to drive Russia out of Ukraine

image.altText: A dozen men in military uniforms stand around the rim of a ship floating on water

props.synopsis: HMAS Toowoomba, who's divers sustained minor injuries from a Chinese sonar pulse, has now begun joint naval patrols in the South China Sea where regional tensions with Beijing are growing.

title.children: Australian warship involved in a Chinese sonar incident begins joint naval drills with Philippines in South China Sea

image.altText: A man with an earring, beard, braids and a shaved side of the head looks at a woman with purple hair and earrings

props.synopsis: The Sydneysider couple had planned their dream wedding at a famous movie set, but everything changed when their cruise ship failed to meet New Zealand's biohazard rules.

title.children: Couple's planned wedding ruined when P&O cruise had to be turned back from New Zealand

image.altText: A woman and man sit on a couch with a younger woman sitting in the middle of them

props.synopsis: Despite cultural preference for sons in some Asian societies, researchers from Monash University Malaysia found that living with daughters is positively associated with happiness in old age.

title.children: What determines happiness in old age? Researchers say living with a daughter could help

image.altText: A middle aged man leans against a ute looking out over a completely blackened land.

props.synopsis: Sid Godwin says back-burning may have prevented a bushfire on his property where he lost 10,000 hectares of grazing land.

title.children: Excessive red tape and 'unmanaged' national parks blamed for Queensland bushfire devastation

image.altText: A still capture from a video of courtroom footage showing Derek Chauvin at his sentencing hearing, June 2021.

props.synopsis: Minnesota attorney-general says Derek Chauvin, the former Minneapolis police officer convicted of murdering George Floyd, has been attacked at a federal prison in Arizona.

title.children: George Floyd's murderer Derek Chauvin stabbed in US prison

image.altText: An illustration of a man and woman on a tandem bike both riding while reading a book, surrounded by books

props.synopsis: Much anticipated new works by winners of the Miles Franklin Literary Award and the Booker Prize are the books our critics couldn't put down this month.

title.children: The seven books our critics couldn't put down in November

image.altText: A man in the water on a kayak.

props.synopsis: A 47-year-old man has set the new record of 14 days, 23 hours and 33 minutes for the feat — and he did it without a phone to entertain him, after a mishap on the first day.

title.children: Man breaks record for fastest kayak down 2,287km Murray River, with no entertainment

image.altText: Courtney Bruce

props.synopsis: Super Netball stars boycott their awards night, as Diamonds players are forced to attend due to contractual obligations.

title.children: Super Netball stars boycott awards as Bruce claims second Liz Ellis Diamond

image.altText: Blackened bushland behind a fence.

props.synopsis: Firefighters have succeeded in containing a devastating blaze in Perth's north, but a severe weather warning has authorities on alert heading into Sunday.

title.children: 'Difficult times ahead': Firefighters contain Perth blaze but brace for 'severe' weather

image.altText: a woman smiling under the sun

props.synopsis: The Queensland government allowed its mine safety commissioner Kate du Preez to keep acting in her role after accepting a lucrative job offer from a coal giant that has multiple convictions over workplace deaths and injuries, ABC Investigations has found.

title.children: Why a mine safety commissioner's new corporate gig is raising eyebrows about lobbying rules

image.altText: A fish and chip menu board

props.synopsis: State and federal consumer affairs ministers vote to implement compulsory country of origin labelling of seafood in all hospitality venues.

title.children: Restaurants will soon be required to tell you where their seafood was caught, under new country of origin rules

image.altText: Storm cell over northern Australia

props.synopsis: Cattle producers spent most of 2023 reading stories about El Niño, which seems to have affected market confidence.

title.children: Did Australia's cattle industry have a 'chronic overreaction' to El Niño?

image.altText: Six women and a man lined up behind each other wearing bright red costumes and painted white faces.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of people use kayaks and floats to block the Port of Newcastle for 30 hours to protest coal exports and a lack of action on climate change.

title.children: Coal miners and flood victims among those paddling out to block world's largest coal port

image.altText: Young teacher Brittany Herrington standing in a colourful Year 5 classroom.

props.synopsis: "Unsustainable workloads" and children with increasingly complex needs are among the reasons why more and more teachers are considering quitting, according to a new union survey.

title.children: Young teacher racks up 20 hours a week in overtime and $17k on work expenses

image.altText: A woman holds a photo at a rally against domestic violence.

props.synopsis: For the second time in as many days, domestic violence prevention campaigners rally in Adelaide calling for systemic reform in response to the recent deaths of four women, including Jodie Jewell who was shot dead at Modbury North.

title.children: Friend of shooting victim Jodie Jewell speaks out as advocates rally against domestic violence

image.altText: A fire ant nest in Ipswich

props.synopsis: The NSW Department of Primary Industries (DPI) have confirmed the detection of three red imported fire ant nests in South Murwillumbah in north-eastern NSW.

title.children: 'Worst of the worst': Fire ant infestation marches over the NSW border

image.altText: Canola crops with mountain ranges behind

props.synopsis: John Snooke says the Pacific Seeds' "garrison" canola variety's underperformance has cost him more than $70,000, but the company will not pay compensation.

title.children: A fifth of a farmer's canola crop died — then the seed company asked him to sign an NDA

image.altText: Lions players celebrate a goal with disappointed Cats players in the background

props.synopsis: Brisbane will play North Melbourne or Adelaide in the AFLW grand final after a preliminary final win over Geelong, but a knee injury to Dakota Davidson sours celebrations.

title.children: Lions advance to fifth AFLW grand final, but win over Cats comes at a cost

image.altText: people crowding around a body bag on a stretcher next to an ambulance

props.synopsis: A fire tears through a shopping mall in the southern Pakistani city of Karachi, killing at least 10 people and injuring 22 others.

title.children: 10 dead in fire in Pakistan shopping mall

image.altText: Fahad at Red Rooster

props.synopsis: You might think all students stand equal at the doorstep of Australia’s universities. But when Fahad tried to become a doctor, he had to navigate a system that seemed to punish him.

title.children: The odds of becoming a doctor when you live west of the 'Red Rooster line'
